intro: Erythroxylum amplifolium var. myrtilloides, commonly known as the purpleleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet to purple flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms.
